instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3787 No image and fans spin then slow down, then speed up
threads.message: I have a strange one on the bench tonight. The owner said they spilled something on the keyboard and it stopped working.I opened the bottom and noticed a burn mark next to the LCD connector. L8300 had melted, sticking itself to the board and destroying part of the trace under it. The computer has no image and seems like it is power cycling. The fans will spin some what fast, then slow down, then back up. Is that an in indication of power cycling? the G3H rails are present but that is as far as I got.

threads.title: 820-3787 No image and fans spin then slow down, then speed up
threads.message:
If fan spins, you get 5V_S0.
Check if all voltages, including VCORE come on.

Remove LCD connector and clean that area first.

threads.title: 820-3787 No image and fans spin then slow down, then speed up
threads.message: Are you saying you want me to remove the LCD connector from the logic board?

threads.title: 820-3787 No image and fans spin then slow down, then speed up
threads.message: Ok, So I measured the power rails and all are there. They all power cycle constantly after being stable for about 10 seconds. The fans will slow down and simultaneously the voltage on each rail will drop out then come back in a repeated cycle.

threads.title: 820-3787 No image and fans spin then slow down, then speed up
threads.message:
My mistake, I was thinking LCD connector was melt; in fact you've mentioned L8300.

Do you get VCORE for sure?
PLT_RESET_L comes on?
Did you try SMC bypass mode?
Try also known good FULL BIOS.

threads.title: 820-3787 No image and fans spin then slow down, then speed up
threads.message: Re-Checked, I get PPVCC_S0_CPU (1.8V) and PLT_RESET_L (3.3V) I will try SMC Bypass and BIOS. I'll need to get a dump from somewhere.  Ithink I have one nut I do not have any other 820-3787 machines at the moment.

threads.title: 820-3787 No image and fans spin then slow down, then speed up
820-3787 No image and fans spin then slow down, then speed up
threads.message: Looks like this board is ok. When I plugged the battery and everything and started it the fans would spin at a constant RPM. The LCD panel wouldn't display an image but the computer works with an external monitor.
